basics.name: Information Technology Specialist
basics.label: Systems Administrator
basics.summary: Quality-driven and practical Systems Administrator with [Number] years aligning business systems with business policies and guidelines.

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Maintained and troubleshoot complex infrastructure. Provided first level of troubleshooting to customers on multiple systems. Diagnosed and replaced failed hardware Line-Replaceable units (LRU). Performed network management services and monitored operating system, Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) software.
highlights: Automated repeatable tasks where possible to increase efficiency
Consistently received a 100% rate of customer satisfaction
Performed root cause analysis to identify system errors and improve accuracy by 15%
Awarded with the Tech of the quarter for contributions to mission

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Involved in mission related certification, system testing, problem analysis and total system product analysis. Performed technical planning, system integration, supportability and effective analysis for multiple systems. Provided continued maintenance and development of bug fixes and patch sets for existing web applications.
highlights: Obtained all mission related certification required for the application services provider
Trained current and new team members on existing and new application services procedure and Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) software
Performed system health analysis to identify, analyze, collect preliminary data, and recommend effective solution to anomalies
Coordinated with systems partners to finalize designs and confirm requirements are met

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Coordinated all NEAS weekly brown-bag seminar for the VA-95 Technical Resource Center. Served as Windows Subject Matter Expert (SME) to research, create procedures and recommended COTS product.
highlights: Served as Windows Subject Matter Expert (SME) to research, create procedures and recommended COTS product
